name: Nitrogen fixation
description: Converts atmospheric nitrogen (N₂) into ammonium (NH₄⁺), making it available to plants.

name: Phosphorus solubilization
description: Mobilizes locked-up phosphorus in soil, converting it into plant-available forms.

name: Potassium solubilization
description: Releases potassium from mineral-bound forms, increasing availability for root uptake.

name: Iron reduction
description: Reduces Fe³⁺ to Fe²⁺ or produces siderophores to enhance iron availability to plants.

name: Manganese reduction
description: Improves manganese uptake through microbial redox reactions in the rhizosphere.

name: Zinc mobilization
description: Releases chelated or bound zinc, enhancing plant absorption of this key micronutrient.

name: Sulfur oxidation
description: Converts elemental sulfur or organic sulfur into sulfate (SO₄²⁻), usable by plants.

name: Plant hormone production
description: Produces growth-promoting hormones like auxins, gibberellins, and cytokinins.

name: Induced systemic resistance (ISR)
description: Triggers the plant's immune system to respond more effectively to future pathogen attacks.

name: Pathogen suppression
description: Inhibits or outcompetes harmful fungi, bacteria, or nematodes in the root or leaf zone.

name: Insect pest biocontrol
description: Naturally targets, repels, or infects insect pests such as aphids, thrips, or whiteflies.

name: Mycorrhizal symbiosis
description: Forms symbiotic associations with plant roots, enhancing water and nutrient uptake.

name: Organic matter decomposition
description: Accelerates breakdown of crop residues, stubble, or green material to recycle nutrients.

name: Compost enhancement
description: Boosts composting efficiency by increasing microbial activity and decomposition rates.

name: Biofilm disruption and rhizosphere balance
description: Disrupts harmful microbial biofilms and supports beneficial soil microbial populations.

name: Moisture retention via mucilage
description: Produces water-binding gels that help retain soil moisture and reduce drought stress.

name: Heavy metal detoxification
description: Immobilizes or transforms toxic heavy metals (e.g. aluminum, cadmium) in the soil.

name: Salinity tolerance improvement
description: Enhances plant resilience to salt stress through osmolyte production or ion modulation.

name: Improved seedling emergence
description: Promotes early root development and uniform seedling emergence for stronger establishment.

name: Rhizosphere microbial balancing
description: Rebalances the soil microbiome to favor beneficial organisms over pathogens.
